net.cabezudo.json.values

Class JSONBoolean

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.cabezudo.json.JSONElement
      • net.cabezudo.json.values.JSONValue<JSONBoolean>
        • net.cabezudo.json.values.JSONBoolean
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<JSONBoolean>, JSONable

    public class JSONBoolean
extends JSONValue<JSONBoolean>
    A JSONBoolean is an object extended from JSONValue object in order to represent a boolean that can be used to create JSON structures.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static JSONBoolean FALSE
      A JSONBoolean false object.
      static JSONBoolean TRUE
      A JSONBoolean true object.

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public static JSONBoolean get(boolean value)
        Return a JSONBoolean that corresponds with the boolean value passed.
        Parameters:
        value - a boolean value.
        Returns:
        Return a JSONBoolean.

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(JSONBoolean jsonBoolean)
        Compares this JSONBoolean with another.
        Parameters:
        jsonBoolean - the JSONBoolean to be compared.
        Returns:
        zero if this object represents the same boolean value as the argument; a positive value if this object represents true and the argument represents false; and a negative value if this object represents false and the argument represents true

      • toReferencedElement

        public JSONBoolean toReferencedElement()
        Return the referenced element for this object. For a JSONBoolean object, this object and the referenced version is the same.
        Specified by:
        toReferencedElement in class JSONElement
        Returns:
        this object.
